term.name: Neoism
term.source: From English prefix neo-: new, young; transliterated from Greek prefix νεο-.
term.def: A parodistic and self-contradicting, yet practical, philosophy. An example of its self-contradicting nature is the heavy influence of &anarchism; and &indivdualism; while at the same time highly valuing collective identity.
An art movement based on the philosophy of the same name. It is influenced by &postmodernism;.
